bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 124 (Tuesday, July 24, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. MENG:H.R. 6497.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, of the United States Constitution[Page H7156]

Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

item.title: Train Coverings for Community Safety Act
To enhance rail safety and provide for the safe and covered transport of materials in railroad cars, and for other purposes.
Train Coverings for Community Safety Act

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Train Coverings for Community Safety Act

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Train Coverings for Community Safety Act

This bill requires the Department of Transportation to prescribe regulations requiring materials transported by rail to be completely covered while in transit, including while being held, delayed, or transferred.

bill.title: Train Coverings for Community Safety Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
